page.title: 18BARNARD GATE
page.content: In the gradual improvement of the A40 the road was moved a few yards to the south of Barnard Gate, to straighten out a bend, and the hamlet now has the appearance of a 'deserted village'. A short stretch of wide metalled but now hardly used road forms a sort of layby to the main road, with a few cottages and small farm buildings on either side. Its public house continues to function, though its size suggests that it was built to cater for the trunk road traffic which must now use the 'Evenlode', a Berni Inn on the opposite side of the A40, and a 'Little Chef' restaurant that is also on the south of the road, just outside our block. A tiny disused chapel constructed of wood and corrugated iron still stands in the hamlet, and just outside is the south gate and lodge to Eynsham Hall Park.
